purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 甫 indicates the sound; 舍 (house) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 舍 [ shě ] house, dwelling; to reside, to dwell; to abandon, to give up
    • 甫 [ fǔ ] to begin; man, father; great; a distance of ten li
humanum_full_description_en:
From " she " to " fu " sound. " Pu " is a vulgar word for " shop ", which usually means shops and stores. "Zhengzitong. "The Ministry of Gold": "Pub, vulgar." Such as Wu Chengen of the Ming Dynasty "Journey to the West" Chapter 69: "Knowing that you have failed to learn from the scriptures, you want to have no money in your career, see here today, I am rich, trying to open a medicine shop. "A Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 77 by Cao Xueqin in the Qing Dynasty: "Our shop often trades with the participating bank. Now I went to talk to my mom, and asked my brother to ask a buddy to discuss with the participating bank and ask him to take the unmade original branches. It's good to join in two or two."

" Shop " is also the same as " Shop ", which means bedding and bed. Such as Feng Menglong in the Ming Dynasty "Jing Shi Tong Yan. "Yu Zhongju's poem meets the emperor": "Yu Liang had been drinking for a long time, and was so sleepy that he fell on the bed and fell asleep."

" Pu " also means stretch. For example, the third fold of Qin Jianfu's "Hair Cutting and Waiting for Guests" in the Yuan Dynasty: "You will be asked to fold your hips and cross your hands when you get there, and leave your school to lay your eyebrows."
humanum_short_description_en: From " she " to " fu " sound. " Pu " is a vulgar word for " shop ", which usually means shops and stores.
humanum_full_description:
從「舍」，「甫」聲。「舖」是「鋪」的後起俗字，多表示商店、店鋪。《正字通．金部》：「鋪，俗作舖。」如明代吳承恩《西遊記》第69回：「知你取經之事不果，欲作生涯無本，今日見此處富庶，設法要開藥舖哩。」清代曹雪芹《紅樓夢》第77回：「我們舖子裏常和參行交易，如今我去和媽說了，叫哥哥去托個伙計過去和參行商議說明，叫他把未作的原枝好參兌二兩來。」

　　「舖」又同「鋪」，表示臥具、床鋪。如明代馮夢龍《警世通言．俞仲舉題詩遇上皇》：「俞良弄了半日酒，身體困倦，跌倒在床舖上，也睡去了。」

　　「舖」還表示舒展。如元代秦簡夫《剪髮待賓》第三摺：「到那裏則要你折腰叉手，休學那苫眼舖眉。」
humanum_short_description: 從「舍」，「甫」聲。「舖」是「鋪」的後起俗字，多表示商店、店鋪。

Hanzi: 铺
從「 舍 」，「 甫 」聲。「 舖 」是「 鋪 」的後起俗字，多表示商店、店鋪。《正字通．金部》：「鋪，俗作舖。」如明代吳承恩《西遊記》第69回：「知你取經之事不果，欲作生涯無本，今日見此處富庶，設法要開藥舖哩。」清代曹雪芹《紅樓夢》第77回：「我們舖子裏常和參行交易，如今我去和媽說了，叫哥哥去托個伙計過去和參行商議說明，叫他把未作的原枝好參兌二兩來。」 「 舖 」又同「 鋪 」，表示臥具、床鋪。如明代馮夢龍《警世通言．俞仲舉題詩遇上皇》：「俞良弄了半日酒，身體困倦，跌倒在床舖上，也睡去了。」 「 舖 」還表示舒展。如元代秦簡夫《剪髮待賓》第三摺：「到那裏則要你折腰叉手，休學那苫眼舖眉。」
From " she" to " fu" sound. " Pu" is a vulgar word for " shop", which usually means shops and stores. "Zhengzitong. "The Ministry of Gold": "Pub, vulgar." Such as Wu Chengen of the Ming Dynasty "Journey to the West" Chapter 69: "Knowing that you have failed to learn from the scriptures, you want to have no money in your career, see here today, I am rich, trying to open a medicine shop. "A Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 77 by Cao Xueqin in the Qing Dynasty: "Our shop often trades with the participating bank. Now I went to talk to my mom, and asked my brother to ask a buddy to discuss with the participating bank and ask him to take the unmade original branches. It's good to join in two or two." " Shop" is also the same as " Shop", which means bedding and bed. Such as Feng Menglong in the Ming Dynasty "Jing Shi Tong Yan. "Yu Zhongju's poem meets the emperor": "Yu Liang had been drinking for a long time, and was so sleepy that he fell on the bed and fell asleep." " Pu" also means stretch. For example, the third fold of Qin Jianfu's "Hair Cutting and Waiting for Guests" in the Yuan Dynasty: "You will be asked to fold your hips and cross your hands when you get there, and leave your school to lay your eyebrows."

舖字的基本解释

舖
pù
同“铺2”。

舖字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pū］
［《廣韻》普胡切，平模，滂。］
［《廣韻》芳無切，平虞，敷。］
亦作“舖1”。“铺1”的繁体字。
(1)古铜器之一种。豆属。
(2)陈列；布置。
(3)展开；摊平。
(4)披挂；覆盖。
(5)铺叙。
(6)布；宣扬。
(7)潽，溢出。
(8)量词。多用以表示面积或体积较大的物量。
(9)铺首。著于门上的衔环兽面。
(10)象声词。
(11)通“痡”。病苦。
(12)通“鎛”。锄田去草的农具。
(13)通“餔”。参见“鋪食”。
[②]［pù］
［《廣韻》普故切，去暮，滂。］
亦作“舖2”。“铺2”的繁体字。
(1)卧具；床铺。
(2)商店。
(3)驿站。

shop
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［pū］
["Guangyun" Puhuqie, flat model, peng. ]
["Guangyun" Fang Wuqie, Pingyu, Fu. ]
Also known as "Shop 1". Traditional characters for "铺1".
(1) A kind of bronze ware. Legumes.
(2) Display; layout.
(3) Expand; flatten.
(4) Draping; covering.
(5) Shop narration.
(6) Cloth; publicity.
(7) 潽, overflow.
(8) Quantifiers. It is mostly used to indicate the amount of objects with a larger area or volume.
(9) Shop the first. The beast face of the title ring attached to the door.
(10) Onomatopoeia.
(11) Through "痡". Suffering.
(12) Through "镈". Farm tools for hoeing the fields and grass.
(13) Through "餔". See "spread food".
[②]［pù］
["Guang Yun" cut all the way, go to the evening, punishing. ]
Also known as "Shop 2". Traditional characters for "铺2".
(1) Bedding; bed.
(2) Store.
(3) Post station.
